hu.kazocsaba.math.matrix

Interface SubmatrixAccessor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SubmatrixAccessor2, SubmatrixAccessor3
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSubmatrixAccessor, ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor, ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor2, ImmutableSubmatrixViewAccessor3

    public interface SubmatrixAccessor
    Provides strongly typed access to submatrices. The exact semantics of the accessor methods depend on the implementation.
    Author:
    Kaz√≥ Csaba

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector column(int col)
      Returns an entire column.
      Matrix matrix(int row, int col, int rowCount, int colCount)
      Returns a submatrix.

      Returns a 2x2 submatrix.
      Matrix3 matrix3(int row, int col)
      Returns a 3x3 submatrix.

      Returns an entire row.

      Returns a row subvector.

    • Method Detail

      • matrix

        Matrix matrix(int row,
            int col,
            int rowCount,
            int colCount)
        Returns a submatrix. Note that unlike Matrix.getSubmatrix, this function expects the dimensions of the submatrix.
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the submatrix
        col - the first column of the submatrix
        rowCount - the number of rows in the submatrix
        colCount - the number of columns in the submatrix
        Returns:
        the specified submatrix
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper submatrix

      • matrix2

        Matrix2 matrix2(int row,
              int col)
        Returns a 2x2 submatrix. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+1, col+1).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the submatrix
        col - the first column of the submatrix
        Returns:
        the specified submatrix
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper submatrix

      • matrix3

        Matrix3 matrix3(int row,
              int col)
        Returns a 3x3 submatrix. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+2, col+2).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the submatrix
        col - the first column of the submatrix
        Returns:
        the specified submatrix
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper submatrix

      • vector

        Vector vector(int row,
            int col,
            int dimension)
        Returns a subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+dimension-1, col).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the subvector
        col - the column containing the subvector
        dimension - the dimension of the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • vector2

        Vector2 vector2(int row,
              int col)
        Returns a 2D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+1, col).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the subvector
        col - the column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • vector3

        Vector3 vector3(int row,
              int col)
        Returns a 3D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+2, col).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the subvector
        col - the column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • vector4

        Vector4 vector4(int row,
              int col)
        Returns a 4D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row+3, col).
        Parameters:
        row - the first row of the subvector
        col - the column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • rowVector

        Vector rowVector(int row,
               int col,
               int dimension)
        Returns a row subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row, col+dimension-1), but returns them as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the subvector
        col - the first column containing the subvector
        dimension - the dimension of the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • rowVector2

        Vector2 rowVector2(int row,
                 int col)
        Returns a 2D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row, col+1), but returns them as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the subvector
        col - the first column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • rowVector3

        Vector3 rowVector3(int row,
                 int col)
        Returns a 3D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row, col+2), but returns them as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the subvector
        col - the first column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • rowVector4

        Vector4 rowVector4(int row,
                 int col)
        Returns a 4D subvector. This function selects the elements between (row, col) and (row, col+3), but returns them as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the subvector
        col - the first column containing the subvector
        Returns:
        the specified subvector
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the parameters do not specify a proper subvector

      • row

        Vector row(int row)
        Returns an entire row. This function selects the elements between (row, 0) and (row, c-1) where c is the number of columns in this matrix, but returns these elements as a column vector.
        Parameters:
        row - the index of the row
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if row is not a valid row index

      • column

        Vector column(int col)
        Returns an entire column. This function selects the elements between (0, col) and (r-1, col) where r is the number of rows in this matrix.
        Parameters:
        col - the index of the column
        Returns:
        IllegalArgumentException if col is not a valid column index
